intro: Teclea salicifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed teclea, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow trees. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the dry season. Teclea salicifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils in highland regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local communities.
